original: Johansson, Anders, rektor. Vara, f. 17/5/81 i Bäreberg, Skarab. 1., av Johannes Larsson o. Johanna Andreas-dotter. G. 13 m. Stina Andersson. Barn: Karin f. 14. — Agronomex. 09, stud. v. GbgiS högsk. 17-23. Lär. v. Tjörns folkhögsk. 10, förest, där 11-15, grund, av samt förest. 15-20 f. lantman nas k. o. folkhögsk. i Tumie-berg, rektor o. före&t. f. Skarab. 1. västra folkhögsk. i Vara sed. 20. Lantbr:ombud 25-33, led. av Vara komm:ful’lm. ised. 43. Stud:res. t. fl. europ. länder isamt t. Egypten, Palestina o. Syr. Skr.: Småbruksekon. anteckn. (14), I ’lantbrukets livsfrågor (14), Skaraborgs lanitbruk o. Skaraborg-is-historier m. m. (43), Gamle-gårds folket (40), Böneman El ver (45). RVO, Iqmil 46.
translated: Johansson, Anders, principal. Vara, born May 17, 1881 in Bäreberg, Skaraborg. Son of Johannes Larsson and Johanna Andreasdotter. Married to Stina Andersson in 1913. Child: Karin, born in 1914. Graduated as an agronomist in 1909, studied at Gbgis University from 1917 to 1923. Teacher at Tjörns folk high school in 1910, served as director there from 1911 to 1915. Founded and served as director of a rural and folk high school in Tumieberg from 1915 to 1920. Became principal and chairman of the Skaraborg 1st Western Folk High School in Vara from 1920. Agricultural representative from 1925 to 1933, member of Vara Municipal Council from 1943. Studied abroad in various European countries as well as Egypt, Palestine, and Syria. Written works: "Small farm economy notes" (1914), "Issues of agricultural life" (1914), "Skaraborg agriculture and Skaraborg history, and more" (1943), "The folks of Gamle-gård" (1940), "The Böneman River" (1945). Awarded RVO (The Royal Order of Vasa) in 1946.

work.name: Rural and folk high school in Tumieberg

structured.description: Anders Johansson (1881-05-17) was a Swedish principal. He was born in Bäreberg, Skaraborg, to parents Johannes Larsson and Johanna Andreasdotter. Anders married Stina Andersson in 1913 and they had a daughter named Karin (born 1914). He earned his agronomist credential in 1909 and studied at Gbgis University from 1917 to 1923. Anders worked as a teacher and director at Tjörns folk high school from 1910 to 1915. He also founded and served as director of a rural and folk high school in Tumieberg from 1915 to 1920. From 1920 onwards, he became the principal and chairman of the Skaraborg 1st Western Folk High School in Vara. Anders worked as an agricultural representative from 1925 to 1933 and was a member of Vara Municipal Council starting from 1943. Alongside his work, Anders studied abroad in various European countries, as well as Egypt, Palestine, and Syria. He authored several books such as 'Small farm economy notes' (1914), 'Issues of agricultural life' (1914), 'Skaraborg agriculture and Skaraborg history, and more' (1943), 'The folks of Gamle-gård' (1940), and 'The Böneman River' (1945). In 1946, Anders was awarded The Royal Order of Vasa.
